name: Keflavík International Airport
description: Keflavík International Airport establishes Iceland's sole major international aviation hub processing 7.51 million passengers projected 2026 connecting 90 global destinations through 29 airline carriers positioning 25-square-kilometer facility Iceland's critical transportation infrastructure economic engine supporting tourism industry nationwide connectivity. Located 50 kilometers southwest Reykjavík Reykjanes Peninsula airport's strategic North Atlantic position historically served crucial military role NATO operations Cold War era transitioning civilian aviation dominance 1980s-1990s becoming Iceland's premier gateway replacing smaller Reykjavík Airport international services. Icelandair maintains dominant carrier status operating 281 weekly departures followed easyJet secondary position while transatlantic carriers Delta United WestJet Air Canada Alaska Airlines provide North American connections alongside European operators Lufthansa British Airways SAS Norwegian Wizz Air establishing comprehensive route network spanning continents. Copenhagen represents busiest route 24 weekly departures while longest flights reach Miami Orlando requiring 8+ hour transatlantic crossings demonstrating airport's extensive international reach. Single terminal divided two buildings provides arrivals departures customs currency exchange tax refunds car rentals extensive shopping dining creating modern passenger experience supporting Iceland's tourism-dependent economy. Blue Lagoon proximity Golden Circle access position Keflavík strategic starting point Iceland adventures enabling immediate tourist attraction engagement arrival departure convenience maximizing limited timeframes international visitors.
